Authors: Ongowarsito H., Djojo B.W., Ferino F.
Title: The Impact of e-CRM Implementation to Bank Performance Through e-Service Quality
Source title: Proceedings of 2018 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2018
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Management Department, Bina Nusantara University, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Ongowarsito, H., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Djojo, B.W., Management Department, Bina Nusantara University, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Ferino, F., Management Department, Bina Nusantara University, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The purpose of this research was to analyze the impact of e-CRM implementation on bank performance through e-Service Quality and what are the features to be concerned further. The study was conducted in the business process of public bank in Jakarta. The questionnaires were distributed to 58 corporate customers of this public bank using cluster sampling method. Analysis obtained using quantitative research with partial least square (PLS) model. The result of this study found that e-CRM system helps bank performance to accelerate the registration process, product implementation, and help customer dealing with various feature offered. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: bank performance; e-CRM implementation; e-Service Quality
Index Keywords: Information management; Surveys; Bank performance; Business Process; Cluster sampling; Corporate customers; E-service quality; Partial least square (PLS); Quantitative research; Registration process; Quality of service
